keyword: calories in a sausage and biscuit
title: Calories in a Sausage and Biscuit
meta_description: Discover calories in a sausage and biscuit, including protein, carbs, fat, full nutrition breakdown, and easy tweaks for variations.
h1: Calories in a Sausage and Biscuit
assumptions: Pork sausage patty (about 50g) with a plain buttermilk biscuit (about 50g), baked or fried; no added cheese, egg, or condiments.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, recipe, size, and preparation method. Fast-food versions may differ; check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A typical sausage and biscuit provides ~320 kcal, with 12 g protein and 30 g carbs.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaging.

tweaks.label: Add one slice of American cheese
Use turkey sausage instead of pork

faqs.q: How many calories in a sausage and biscuit from fast food?
faqs.a: Typically 300-400 kcal; varies by chain like McDonald's or Wendy's.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a sausage and biscuit?
faqs.a: About 12 g from the sausage patty.

faqs.q: Are sausage biscuits high in sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, around 800 mg due to sausage and biscuit ingredients.

faqs.q: How do carbs break down in a sausage and biscuit?
faqs.a: Mostly from the biscuit: ~30 g total carbs, 1 g fiber, 2 g sugars.

faqs.q: Can I make a lower-calorie sausage and biscuit?
faqs.a: Yes, opt for turkey sausage and whole-grain biscuit to cut ~40-60 kcal.
